organization.fullName: The First Hospital of Jilin University

identificationModule.briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy of Urinary Kallidinogenase for Large Artery Atherosclerosis Acute Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Safety and Efficacy of Urinary Kallidinogenase for Large Artery Atherosclerosis Acute Ischemic Stroke：a Multicentre, Prospective, Randomised, Open-label, Blinded-Endpoint Trial

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Associated Dean of the First Hospital of Jilin University
responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: The First Hospital of Jilin University

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of urinary kallidinogenase treatment in patients with large artery atherosclerotic acute ischemic stroke.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Currently, evidence regarding the safety and efficacy of urinary kallidinogenase treatment in patients with acute ischemic stroke lacks, and few of related studies were large-scale and high-quality. Thus, this study was designed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of urinary kallidinogenase treatment in patients with large artery atherosclerotic acute ischemic stroke.

armGroups.label: Urinary Kallidinogenase group
armGroups.description: Patients are treated with urinary kallidinogenase and guideline-prescribed basic medical therapy.

armGroups.label: Control group
armGroups.description: Patients are only treated with guideline-prescribed basic medical therapy.

interventions.name: Urinary kallidinogenase for injection
interventions.description: Urinary kallidinogenase 0.15PNA once daily for 7 days.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with Modified Rankin Scale (mRS) Score 0-2 at 90 days
primaryOutcomes.description: Modified Rankin Scale (mRS) ranged from 0 to 6, a low value represents a better outcome.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: National Institute of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) at 7days.
secondaryOutcomes.description: National Institute of Health stroke Scale (NIHSS) ranged from 0 to 42, a low value represents a better outcome.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of ischemic stroke within 90 days.
secondaryOutcomes.description: Including recurrent and new ischemic stroke.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Adverse events occurring in the course of the treatment.
secondaryOutcomes.description: Including all adverse events, severe adverse events and urinary kallidinogenase related adverse events.

overallOfficials.name: Yi Yang, MD,PhD
overallOfficials.affiliation: The First Hospital of Jilin University
